intro: Don't mind me, I'm just a peer.

post.body: Aw snap! I think I overwritten my account with the new one (?)

I have a #question about how #ZeroNet edits and deletions work:

If I post something on Zeronet, then edit it or delete it, the peers that had the "old" version of the post/page are able to access (in any way) access that old version after it is updated/deleted?

I wonder if edits are kept like a diff or a change log somewhere, or if it's only the last version of the content available to see...

comment.body: What about Opeth, Bloodbath, Black Dahliah Murder, Cannibal Corpse, Anaal Nathrakh?
Plus is not (yet) great for downloading large files or streaming.

Something similar is happening everywhere else. People making laws about something they don't even understand, or even bother to try to understand. They open their mouths only to be publicly humiliated.
@Binchan: Does that mean that once a newer version of a page or post is signed and distributed, there is *no way* to get an older version? I'm not saying only "officially".
@Binchan: and what about for someone who only has the new file? Say a new ZN user, or someone who has alreaady received the update.
Don't get me started with Optimus
It says secure on the link. Not phishy at all. Nope.
@Don_Ehrenmann: Ok, I know those guys. Anyway, I think it's a bad choice of name, sounds phishy as hell to me...
